com.pcloud.networking.client

Interface Interactor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable

    public interface Interactor
extends java.io.Closeable
    A Iterator-like interface allowing the execution of MultiCalls in a pull-based fashion.

    Using this class when executing MultiCall instances gives more control over connection writes and reads, providing the following benefits:

    • The number of simultaneous request writes can be controlled.
    • Responses can be read in an iterative fashion, avoiding the need for buffering.
    • Reading can start before all requests have been written.
    • The execution can be stopped in the middle of the process, with decisions on each received response.

    NOTE:Take care of calling close() when done with objects of this type, or resource leaks will occur.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close() 
      boolean hasMoreRequests() 
      boolean hasNextResponse() 
      Response nextResponse()

      int submitRequests(int count)
      Write a given amount of requests.

    • Method Detail

      • hasMoreRequests

        boolean hasMoreRequests()
        Returns:
        true if there are more Requests that can be written, false otherwise.

      • submitRequests

        int submitRequests(int count)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Write a given amount of requests.

        When called, the method will block and attempt to send at most count requests, but no more than the remaining request count left to be sent. The returned value is the actual number of requests sent.

        For an example, if the total request count is 5, submitRequests(6) will return 5. Next calls to submitRequests() will always return 0.

        Parameters:
        count - the amount of requests to be sent
        Returns:
        the actual number of sent requests
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when count < 0
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during sending, or the MultiCall has been cancelled.

      • hasNextResponse

        boolean hasNextResponse()
        Returns:
        true if there are more Responses that can be read, false otherwise.

      • nextResponse

        Response nextResponse()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Read the next response

        When called, the method will block and attempt to read a single response, either returning the result or failing with an error.

        The method will throw an IllegalStateException if the number of sent requests is equal to the number of received responses to avoid the case where the method will be waiting for a response, but none is expected to arrive, thus blocking forever (or a connection read timeout is reached).

        Returns:
        the next Response
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if trying to read more responses than sent requests
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading, or the MultiCall has been cancelled.

      • close

        void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
